cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles ESE of Port O’Connor, Texas and 115 miles S of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow, turn north and finally northeast inland across Louisiana and into Mississippi late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O’Connor / Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA; Storm-Surge Warning: Port Aransas TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast, southwestern and central Louisiana coast, then inland toward Mississippi and the Lower Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≈3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty breezes possible late Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 1–3 ft above ground are possible along the Mississippi coast, including near Pascagoula, mainly late week as onshore flow increases.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Beta could deliver 3–5 inches of rain (locally higher) late Thursday into Friday, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas along the Gulf beaches; isolated brief tornadoes possible in outer rain bands.
